Hi Sina, 

You can try a coevolutionary approach in which multiple populati=
ons compete or cooperate with each other. For this just regular NEAT is apr=
opriate and in my opinion it should work fine. Another possibility is to us=
e real-time NEAT like in the NERO game. You can still try HyperNEAT, but th=
e CPPN to substrate mapping should be designed such that every individual h=
as his own coordinate frame, and if you want your agents to be learning in =
real-time, you can also have the CPPN output your learning coefficients jus=
t like the weights.  

Peter


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Sina Iravanian =
<sina_iravanian@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
> 
> I want to use NEAT for learnin=
g coordination in a multi-agent system.
> But the agents in the system must=
 be learning independently, i.e., they cannot communicate and a centralized=
 controller cannot be used. 
> 
> I would be grateful if anyone could intro=
duce some previous work, or publications which use NEAT (or any of its vari=
ants) in the same settings. 
> 
> Many thanks in advance,
> Sina
>
